intro: Boussingaultia tucumanensis var. brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian tucumanensis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
